ResourceHeader.Description:
The Deep Space Climate Observatory (DSCOVR) is the replacement satellite for NASA's Advanced Composition Explorer (ACE) 
        spacecraft to continue monitoring solar wind near the L1 point . DSCOVR observations are critical to our space weather ready nation. 
        These data support forecasts and research of phenomena that have the potential to disrupt and damage Earth-based infrastructure.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NOAA Space Weather Prediction Center (2016): Deep Space Climate Observatory (DSCOVR). NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information.
